item.title: Dr M drives around KL to 'see anti-Icerd rally aftermath' - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Malaysiakini

Prime Minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad drove himself around Kuala Lumpur this evening, after the rally against the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination (Icerd) ended. According to blogger Firdaus Abdullah, Mahathir was driving to "see for himself the situation in the capital after the anti-Icerd rally". Firdaus had tweeted a video of Mahathir driving a Proton, the interior of which matches the new Proton X70 SUV. The sirens from his police escorts can be heard. The view outside the window places Mahathir near the golden triangle, driving along Jalan ...

item.title: Mahathir invites Umno frogs to join PPBM - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Mahathir invites Umno frogs to join PPBM  Malaysia Today

(MMO) – Despite initially denouncing party defectors, Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad has seemingly softened his stance towards “political frogs”, now saying that it is their democratic right to do so. “We are a democratic government, we believe in democracy, and democracy allows frogs to jump,” a rather impish Dr Mahathir said, when asked when Pakatan Harapan (PH) would propose a law to prevent politicians who switch camps. In October, Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) led by Dr Mahathir, stirred controversy by seeking to accommodate Umno defectors, a move largely seen as a stra...

item.title: Dr M: I can’t attend Suhakam event tomorrow - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Dr M: I can’t attend Suhakam event tomorrow  Malaysia Today

“I decided that we will not accept ICERD. Suhakam wants to accept ICERD. So, how can I go?” (FMT) – Prime Minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad has questioned how he will be able to attend a pro-human rights celebration tomorrow now that the government has taken an about-turn in ratifying ICERD. “I decided that we will not accept ICERD (the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination). “Suhakam (the Malaysian Human Rights Commission) wants to accept ICERD. “So, how can I go?” asked the Pakatan Harapan (PH) chairman after chairing the PH Presidential Council meet...

item.title: Malaysia: Malays rally amid worries over government 'weakness' - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
Malaysia: Malays rally amid worries over government 'weakness'  Al Jazeera English

Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia - Tens of thousands of ethnic Malays have taken to the streets of Malaysia's capital to "celebrate" a government decision not to ratify a key UN anti-discrimination treaty, amid growing concerns the seven-month administration of Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad is losing reform momentum. Malaysia is one of only 14 countries in the world that have yet to sign the International Convention on the Elimination of all forms of Racial Discrimination (ICERD). The treaty what constitutes racial discrimination and sets forth a series of principles and guidelines by which states ...

item.title: Postponement of Human Rights Day celebration ticks off Ambiga - The Star Online
item.description:
Postponement of Human Rights Day celebration ticks off Ambiga  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Activist Datuk Ambiga Sreenevasan (pic) has criticised authorities over the postponement of the Human Rights Day celebration by one day. It will now be held on Sunday (Dec 9). In a series of tweets on Friday (Dec 7), the former Bersih chairman and Bar Council president described the postponement of the celebration by the Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam) as akin to "giving in to bullies". "Asking Suhakam to cancel an event that celebrates International Human Rights Day which many have done for years and years. Wow! That's a first. So now we celebrate by cancelling...

item.title: Dr M thanks one million people for turning up at anti-ICERD rally - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Dr M thanks one million people for turning up at anti-ICERD rally  Malaysia Today

(MMO) – Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today appeared unconcern with the mammoth anti-ICERD ‘thanksgiving’ rally, sarcastically thanking the one million people who turned up at the event. “We know that the gathering today was attended by one million people, and I thank them because they gathered for thanksgiving. One million people. Thank you,” he told a press conference here after the Pakatan Harapan (PH) Presidential Council meeting. He also gave himself a pat on the back, over his recent decision to not ratify the International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial...

item.title: BM version of Billion Dollar Whale launched - The Star Online
item.description:
BM version of Billion Dollar Whale launched  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The Malay edition of the Billion Dollar Whale book has been launched. Entrepreneur Development Minister Datuk Seri Mohd Redzuan Md Yusof, who launched the book here on Saturday (Dec 8), said that the book had revealed much of his suspicion. "It is an excellent piece of writing, which I hope will reach out to the people. It describes what I have found out before," he said. Redzuan said that he was in contact with the Department of Justice in the United States in 2016, and enquired whether there was any truth about alleged stolen funds from the 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB)....

item.title: Pakatan gives Rantau and Cameron Highlands to parties initially contesting seats - The Star Online
item.description:
Pakatan gives Rantau and Cameron Highlands to parties initially contesting seats  The Star Online

In preparation for the anticipated by-elections in Cameron Highlands and Rantau, Pakatan Harapan is ready to field candidates of the same parties which contested those seats in the 14th General Election. Pakatan chairman Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad said the coalition agreed to this at the Pakatan Harapan's presidential council meeting on Saturday (Dec 8). He also said it is up to to the parties to select their candidates when it is called and they will contest under the Pakatan Harapan logo and not PKR's. He told reporters after the Pakatan Harapan presidential council meeting on Saturday.

item.title: Suhakam moves Human Rights Day celebration to Sunday (Dec 9) - The Star Online
item.description:
Suhakam moves Human Rights Day celebration to Sunday (Dec 9)  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam) will postpone its Human Rights Day celebration to Sunday (Dec 9). It tweeted on Friday: "Suhakam's #HumanRightsDay celebration will now be held on 9 December 2018. Join us in #StandingUpForHumanRights". Its chief commissioner Tan Sri Razali Ismail said that the decision to postpone the celebrations was made after they were advised to do so by Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad. Razali said that police had also informed Dr Mahathir of the risk to national security. "The Prime Minister said that he would not be attending the ...

item.title: Ex-Singapore diplomat takes dig at Saifuddin over dispute de-escalation plan - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Ex-Singapore diplomat takes dig at Saifuddin over dispute de-escalation plan  Malaysia Today

(FMT) – Former Singapore diplomat Bilahari Kausikan today took a dig at Foreign Minister Saifuddin Abdullah over his proposal to lower tensions between the neighbours. Accusing Malaysia of creating the problem over territorial intrusions, he mockingly said Putrajaya now wanted Singapore to share responsibility for the problem. He said in a Facebook post: “You have to admire the Malaysian foreign minister’s ctuzpah: You create a problem, when we respond to defend our interests, you say that the solution to the problem you created in the first place is for us to cease defending our interests ...

item.title: Malaysian fugitive Jho Low, four others hit with fresh 1MDB charges - Reuters
item.description:
Malaysian fugitive Jho Low, four others hit with fresh 1MDB charges  Reuters

Malaysian police filed fresh criminal charges and issued arrest warrants for fugitive financier Low Taek Jho and four others wanted in connection with a multi-billion-dollar scandal at state fund 1MDB, officials said on Wednesday. Low, popularly known as Jho Low, has been identified by Malaysian and U.S. investigators as a central figure in the alleged theft of about $4.5 billion from 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB). Low, whose whereabouts is not known, has denied any wrongdoing through a spokesman. Last month, U.S. prosecutors charged Low and two former Goldman Sachs bankers with consp...

item.title: Dr M: Democracy allows 'frogs' to jump - The Star Online
item.description:
Dr M: Democracy allows 'frogs' to jump  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The Government will not be pushing for any anti-hopping law that prevents elected representatives from deserting their parties. "We are a democratic government. Democracy allows frogs to jump," Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad told reporters after the Pakatan Harapan presidential council meeting. The Pakatan chairman was asked whether he will push for an anti party-hopping law during his tenure as Prime Minister, especially when there are elected MPs hopping to his Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (Bersatu). In October, former International Trade and Industry Minister Dat...

item.title: Powerful signals expected from both rallies - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Powerful signals expected from both rallies  Malaysia Today

In a sense, the anti-Icerd rally is a personal challenge to his leadership as the top Malay and Muslim leader. Joceline Tan, The Star THE line in the sand will be more clearly drawn than ever after tomorrow, with the predominantly Malay political opposition on one side and a more mixed ruling coalition on the other. The anti-Icerd rally engineered by PAS and Umno has all the signs of being the biggest Malay-Muslim street protest the country has ever seen in recent times. Parallels are being drawn to the mammoth Islamist rally in Jakarta last weekend that turned the biggest intersection in t...

item.title: Dr M: Pakatan only makes U-turn when wrong road taken - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Dr M: Pakatan only makes U-turn when wrong road taken  Malaysia Today

“We are not perfect people. Although most of us are angels, but even angels sometimes make mistakes. So when angels makes mistakes, they turn around.” (MMO) – Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad today made a cheeky comeback to critics who labelled his administration as a “U-turn government”. In a press conference here using veiled replies, the Langkawi MP said that turnarounds under his governance were only done if necessary, adding that the Pakatan Harapan (PH) Cabinet was not perfect though it has been trying to correct many things. “Sometimes when we go the wrong way, we turn around, ...

item.title: Dr M will not attend Suhakam’s Human Rights Day celebration on Sunday - The Star Online
item.description:
Dr M will not attend Suhakam’s Human Rights Day celebration on Sunday  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad will not be attending the Human Rights Commission of Malaysia (Suhakam)’s Human Rights Day celebration on Sunday (Dec 9). Dr Mahathir explained that this was because the government had already decided against ratifying the International Convention on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination (Icerd), which was in contrary towards Suhakam’s stand on the contentious issue. “I decided that we will not accept Icerd. Suhakam wants to accept Icerd. So, how can I go,” he said. Dr Mahathir said this after chairing Pakatan Harapan’s presidential c...

item.title: Pakatan leaders face rally dilemma - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Pakatan leaders face rally dilemma  Malaysia Today

(The Star) – Pakatan Hara­p­an leaders seem to be in a quandary as to whether disciplinary action should be taken against party members who attend tomorrow’s anti-Icerd (International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination) rally organised by Umno and PAS. So far, no Pakatan party has issued a ban on members attending the anti-Icerd rally. PKR vice-president Zuraida Kamaruddin, however, said action should be taken against PKR members who attend the anti-Icerd rally as the party itself had said it is against the rally. Parti Amanah Nasional (Amanah) president Moh...

item.title: Tun M: We are still negotiating with Singapore over border issue - The Star Online
item.description:
Tun M: We are still negotiating with Singapore over border issue  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysia has yet to respond to Singapore's rejection to stop assets from being deployed to a disputed area in the Johor Straits, in light of the disagreements over the Declaration of Port Limits for Johor Baru Port. Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad said the Government could not give a final answer until negotiations are over. "The important thing is Singapore agreed to negotiations, so until we finish negotiations, we cannot give a final answer," he said. "We need to settle these disputes based on legal provisions and our rights," said the Pakatan Harapan Chairman after...

item.title: Dr M to Jho Low: Don't worry, Malaysian judges are fair - The Star Online
item.description:
Dr M to Jho Low: Don't worry, Malaysian judges are fair  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Fugitive businessman Jho Low need not fear of not having a fair trial in Malaysia, as Malaysian judges are quite fair, says Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad. "He must know he is guilty, so when he is guilty, he will feel that the judgement is not fair," said the Prime Minister. He said everyone had to appear in court and not keep on dismissing the charges or getting judges that may serve an individual's personal interests. "We have to accept the institution of the judiciary is not being interfered by this Government," he said after a meeting with Pakatan Harapan leaders. It was repor...

item.title: PM: M’sia must tackle corruption head-on before joining ranks of developed countries - The Star Online
item.description:
PM: M’sia must tackle corruption head-on before joining ranks of developed countries  The Star Online

Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad on Friday said corruption must be taken seriously if Malaysia wants to join the ranks of developed countries. Describing corruption as an "awful thing", Dr Mahathir said it could cause irreparable damage to society and the nation. He said this in his address at the Sheikh Tamim Hamad Al-Thani International Anti-Corruption Excellence Award ceremony in Putrajaya. Read more at: https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2018/12/07/pm-malaysia-much-tackle-corruption-head-on-before-joining-ranks-of-developed-countries/
